description.narrative: Australia maintains a range of mechanisms to support governments in the Asia-Pacific region to respond effectively to disasters. Funding under this initiative provides support to: 1) UN Office for Coordination of Humanitarian affairs (OCHA) and the commitment to support the United Nationas Disaster Assessment and Coordination (UNDAC) system, one of OCHA's main response tools. The UNDAC system is a stand-by team of disaster management professionals who can be deployed within hours of a disaster to provide rapid assessment of priority needs and support national authorities to coordinate international relief in-country. 2) the International Search and Rescue Advisory Group (INSARAG), a global network of more than 80 countries ans disaster response organisations under the UN umbrella. INSARAG deals with urban search and rescue (USAR) of collapsed structures and related issues. 3) The Asia-Pacific Humanitarian Partnership (APHP). The function of APHP is to support UNDAC missions with Information and Communications Technology (ICT), field camps and service packages such as technical pr logistical services. The total value of this initiative is $248.3 thousand expensed over 2 financial years, starting 2010-11
